thread.title: Are these the most beautiful KITCHENS ever? | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Are these the most beautiful KITCHENS ever? | Daily Mail Online

author: Harvey Day For Mailonline
title: Are these the most beautiful KITCHENS ever? | Daily Mail Online
text:
Share this article Share Kitchen islands are a popular feature in the prize-winning list. One space in the UK has a large wooden work station in the centre of the room as well as a bright copper oven and matching pots and pans. The owner of the Berkshire home is a professional cook and a copper range oven was designed to complement the their existing copper cookware. Elegant: This Irish property has a paired-back style with touches of copper in the light fittings and taps. The project cost €50,000 (£42,500) and was completed for a family who had recently relocated from London Open air: Located in Brisbane, Australia, this kitchen was designed to bring the outside in by capturing the view of the valley, surrounding bush and natural light. The owners are a small family who love entertaining so the design was about balancing the practicalities of family meals with the sophistication to entertain with friends on weekends. It, of course, features a classic Aussie Barbie! Another popular kitchen, located in Malahide, Dublin, was renovated in 2015. The project cost €50,000 (£42,500) and was completed for a family who had recently relocated from London. One snug kitchen, located in the picturesque Navigli area of Milan, Italy, has an elegant marble worktop with black, white and grey geometric floor tiles. The Swedish kitchen has a classic Scandi style with a simple white colour scheme accented by utilitarian chrome cabinets and a large extractor fan. Classic: Found in Aravaca, Madrid, this kitchen was redesigned five years ago as part of a whole home renovation project but still remains one of the most popular kitchen photos on Houzz globally. The homeowners are a young married couple who own and work in their restaurant. They love cooking and having friends around, so for them the open concept kitchen was important to make it the heart of the home. The countertop of the wood island was designed to slide so they can use it as a working table or as a dining table with high stools for eating Stylish: This Italian kitchen has a very simple style with dark blue cabinets, geometric tiled floor and marble worktop. The renovation of the whole apartment cost around €120,000 (£102,000) to create the perfect nest for a new family The Spanish farmhouse-style kitchen has warm red brick walls and a black-and-white checkered tile floor. The room is full of dozens of decorative stars, potted plants and even comes with an in-built wine rack. The Australian kitchen combines indoor and outdoor living with a room that completely opens up to an exterior barbecue area. Rustic: This property, in Newbury, Berkshire, features a large wooden central work space and has a copper colour theme running throughout Understated: This French kitchen has simple white cabinets and a wooden worktop, as well as plentiful storage space The French kitchen makes up for a lack of space with its sleek design and abundant storage. The kitchen in Germany continues the white colour scheme of many of the popular spaces but is accented by some splashes of colour with the choice of accessories, including a statue of a brightly-dressed chef. A 'Best Of Houzz 2017' badge appears on winners’ profiles to help homeowners identify popular and top-rated home professionals in different locations on Houzz. Modern: This German kitchen mixes a white colour scheme with splashes of colour in room's accessories Share or comment on this article
